title: Justbillywitt
author: Justbillywitt
content: When I was in high school my biology teacher told us during our class that we shouldn't eat more than one egg a day. I have always believed this to be true, whenever I see someone eating more than one eggs, I always felt they are ignorant but the truth is I have been the one who has been ignorant that we can eat as many eggs as we want in a day. I relied in what my class room teacher taught me without carrying further research on my own. I recently found out that there are no rules governing how many eggs we can consume in a day. Has anyone had similar experience?

comments.author: johnsaributua
comments.body: I'm not sure if it's a good idea to use a protein powder, but I'm sure it's a good idea to use a protein powder that's good for building muscle mass. it's school time, are you currently consuming more eggs when there's a scarce supply and less carbs? if you're prone to 6-8 grains if you're not bored it's probably okay as long as you don't have a recurring illness like allergies because your daily egg consumption limit exceeds the portion. I'm not too much but maybe every day, many protein sources do not have to be eggs unless my area produces abundant eggs of course I am no stranger if an emergency chooses to consume more eggs. I mean chicken eggs that are 1/4 of a fist or 27-30 grams/egg, do you mean that?

comments.author: mich
comments.body: Well for me it is I was always begin told I need to wait 1 hour to go in water after I eat. When I was young and my father was still around he told me I had to wait 1 hour after we ate if I wanted to go swimming. But now I have done research on this. And there is no reason for us to wait to go in water after we eat. I wish there is a way I could tell this to my father he is wrong all this time but he is out from my life now.

comments.author: Natsuu
comments.body: It's common to rely on what we learn in school, but it's great that you took the initiative to research and discover the truth about egg consumption. Many people might have similar experiences, as nutrition information can evolve over time.
